intro: Alchemilla pseudolaeticolor, commonly known as the silver-leaved alchemilla, is a low-growing perennial plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its unique leaf color and ability to form dense, mat-like growth.
